dc:description:
REN was FIRST reported in relation to autosomal dominant tubulointerstitial kidney (ADTKD; OMIM: 613092) in 2009 (Zivna et al, PMID: 19664745). ADTKD-REN is characterized by a family history of chronic kidney disease, childhood anemia (if the mutation is located in the signal peptide or prosegment of renin), hyperuricemia (in 60% of cases), mild hyperkalemia, bland urinary sediment and slowly progressive chronic kidney disease, leading to end-stage kidney disease (ESKD) at between 30 – 80 years of age (PMIDs: 32750457, 19664745, 21084044, 21903317, 28701203, 31406136, 31586593).
The REN gene is associated with two disease entities by different pattern of inheritance and molecular mechanisms as well as different clinical findings including: (1) Autosomal dominant tubulointerstitial kidney disease (ADTKD-REN; OMIM: 613092) and (2) Renal tubular dysgenesis (RTD; OMIM: 267430). Per criteria outlined by the ClinGen Lumping and Splitting Working Group, these two disease entities have been curated separately.
Variants in REN have been reported in at least 120 individuals (from more than 30 families) and segregated with the disease (PMIDs: 19664745, 32750457, 21084044, 21903317, 28701203, 31406136, 31586593). At least 15 unique variants (including in-frame deletion and missense variants) have been reported. Renin is synthesized as pre-pro-renin consisting of a signal peptide (pre), prosegment (pro) and mature part of renin. More than 60% of cases are caused by mutations in the signal peptide, 25% of mutations are in the prosegment and 15% are in the mature part renin. The mechanism of the disease depends on the mutated domain. Mutations in the signal peptide result in synthesis of a preprorenin that is not processed and is aberrantly located in the cytoplasm. Mutations in the prosegment introduce structural changes affecting protein biosynthesis, folding, and transport along the secretory pathway. Mutations in mature renin lead to retention of the mutated protein in the endoplasmic reticulum. All of these molecular mechanisms result in ER stress activation and cellular toxicity to renin-producing cells, leading to apoptosis, clinical renin deficiency and chronic kidney disease. ADTKD-REN patients have hyporeninemic hypoaldosteronism, which can be treated with administration of the synthetic aldosterone analog fludrocortisone (PMIDs: 21084044, 21473025).
This gene-disease association is supported by immunohistochemical studies of renin in patient kidney biopsies, determination of plasma renin levels, experimental cellular models (PMIDs: 19664745, 32750457) and a zebrafish model (PMID: 31406136). 
In summary, there is DEFINITIVE evidence to support the relationship between REN and autosomal dominant tubulointerstitial kidney disease (ADTKD-REN). This has been repeatedly demonstrated in both the research and clinical diagnostic settings, and has been upheld over time. This classification was approved by the ClinGen Kidney Cystic and Ciliopathy Disorders GCEP Working Group on 10/28/2020 (SOP Version 7).

evidence.dc:description: In vitro translation/translocation assay revealed no translocation ability of Leu16Arg-REN across the ER membrane. Western blot of lyzate after transient expression of Leu16Arg-REN showed biosynthesis of unprocessed (non-translocated) preprorenin which is not secreted into culture media.

In vitro translation/translocation assay revealed that mutation Leu16del-REN affects translocation ability across the ER membrane. Western blot of lyzate after transient expression of Leu16del-REN showed higher portion of unprocessed (non-translocated) preprorenin and decreased amount of secreted prorenin/renin in culture media. In cellular lyzate from cells stably producing Leu16del-REN were detected markers of activated ER stress compare to wt-REN.

Transient expression of mutated and WT gene in HEK cells. Mutation L13Q is located in signal peptide of renin. Mutations in signal peptide of renin lead to synthesis of preprorenin which is not translocated, processed and secreted. Experimental findings correlate with observed phenotypes.

HEK cells expression of mutated and wt renin. Expression of DelL16, L381P and WT of renin in zebra fish. Cellular experimants revealed different localization of mutatted renin within the transfected cells. From Zebra Fish model: 60% of embryos injected with the L381P renin variant showed pronephric alteration: 43% were characterized by reduced, partial convolution of the pronephric tubules and 17% showed absence of tubular convolutions. A similar phenotypic
distribution was observed in embryos injected with the L16del. By contrast, only 9% of
embryos injected with wild type renin showed alterations of pronephric tubules.

In vitro translation/ translocation assays revealed that around 20% of mutated renin was translocated across the ER membrane compare to wt. Western blot of lyzate after transient expression of Cys20Arg-REN showed biosynthesis of unprocessed (non-translocated) preprorenin which is not secreted into culture media. Confocal microscopy showed intracellular accumulation of abnormal renin (which doesn´t form typical granules structures). Renin granulosity assay confirmed no granules formation of mutated renin compare to wt.

Transient expression of mutated and WT gene in HEK cells. Mutation I366N is located in mature part of renin. Mutations in mature part of renin lead to acummulation of mutated renin in endoplasmic reticulum, no processing, no secretion of both renin and prorenin.  Experimental findings correlate with observed phenotypes.
Targeted sequencing after chloroform DNA extraction.

evidence.dc:description: Transient expression of mutated and WT gene in HEK cells. Mutation M39K is located in prosegment domain of renin. Muattions in prosegment of renin lead to aberrant secretion rate of prorenin and renin and partial accummulation in ERGIC. Experimental findings correlate with observed phenotypes.

Transient expression of mutated and WT gene in HEK cells. Mutation T26I is located in prosegment domain of renin. Muattions in prosegment of renin lead to aberrant secretion rate of prorenin and renin and partial accummulation in ERGIC. Experimental findings correlate with observed phenotypes.

In vitro translation/translocation assay revealed no translocation ability of Leu16Pro-REN across the ER membrane. Western blot of lyzate after transient expression of Leu16Arg-REN showed biosynthesis of unprocessed (non-translocated) preprorenin which is not secreted into culture media. Experimental findings correlate with observed phenotypes.

In vitro translation/translocation assay revealed that mutation Leu16del-REN affects translocation ability across the ER membrane. Western blot of lyzate after transient expression of Leu16del-REN showed higher portion of unprocessed (non-translocated) preprorenin and decreased amount of secreted prorenin/renin in culture media. In cellular lyzate from cells stably producing Leu16del-REN were detected markers of activated ER stress compare to wt-REN.

Transient expression of mutated and WT gene in HEK cells. Mutation C325R is located in mature part of renin. Mutations in mature part of renin lead to acummulation of mutated renin in endoplasmic reticulum, no processing, no secretion of both renin and prorenin.  Experimental findings correlate with observed phenotypes.

Transient expression of mutated and WT gene in HEK cells. Mutation W10R is located in signal peptide of renin. Mutations in signal peptide of renin lead to synthesis of preprorenin which is not translocated, processed and secreted. Experimental findings correlate with observed phenotypes.

In model_ At 5 days post fertilization (dpf) no significant alterations in the head, heart, and swim bladder were detected. 60% of embryos injected with the L381P renin variant showed pronephric alteration: 43% were characterized by reduced, partial convolution of the pronephric tubules and 17% showed absence of tubular convolutions. A similar phenotypic distribution was observed in embryos injected with the L16del. By contrast, only 9% of embryos injected with wild type renin showed alterations of pronephric tubules.
Observed changes in zebra fish model correspond to tubulointerstitial changes observed in patients with autosomal dominant mutations in renin and ADTKD-REN.
evidence.rdfs:label: Expression of DelL16, L381P and WT of renin in zebra fish.

evidence.dc:description: The biggest ADTKD-REN cohort around the world consist of 111 individuals from 30 unrelated familes with 15 different heterozygous mutations in three renin domains. All mutations fully segregated with disease. Phenotypic differences such as childhood anemia, age of ESRD correlated with mutation position in preprorenin and different molecular mechanisms detected on level of cellular model.

In international cohort of ADTKD-REN clinical findings revealed 3 distinct subtypes of ADTKD-REN due to position of mutation in renin. Also molecular mechanisms which are responsible for disease development are different. In case of signal peptide mutants - no translocation, no processing, no secretion. In case of prosegment of renin - aberrant secretion rate of prorerenin and renin, partly accummulated in ERGIC. In case of mature part renin - acummulation of mutated renin in endoplasmic reticulum, no processing, no secretion of both renin and prorenin.  All of these results correlate with observed phenotypes.
evidence.rdfs:label: Transient expression of mutated and WT gene in HEK cells

evidence.dc:description: There is strong evidence for pathogenicity of described variants. Results from all experiments are consistent. Also describidng molecular mechanisms that lead to kdiney failure.

Mutations in signal peptide resulting in decreased of its hydrophobicity that resulting in to altered translocation of preprorenin into endoplasmic reticulum. The translocation into ER is necessary for propper posttranslational modifications and biological function.
Mutations lead to biosynthesis of enzymatically inactive preprorenin which is not secreted.
Aberrant biological deffect in processing results in activation of unfolded protein response.
evidence.rdfs:label: Stabile expression of mutated and WT gene in HEK cells

evidence.dc:description: Mutated renin is biosynthesized as biologically inactive preprorenin which is secreted.
evidence.rdfs:label: Transient expression of mutated and WT gene in HEK cells

evidence.dc:description: Results of immunohistochemical staining in kidney biopsy from pateints are strong evidence for causality of identified mutations in signal peptide of renin.
Studied renin mutations lead to reduced expression and abnormal localizaton of prorenin and renin in patients´ kidney compare to age matched kidney controls.
evidence.rdfs:label: Immunohistochemical staining of renin in patients´ kidney
